summary: This is an FBI operations order detailing the planned arrest of Jeffrey Epstein on July 6, 2019, upon his return to the US via Teterboro Airport, and the subsequent execution of a search warrant at his New York residence. The document includes a synopsis of the child sex trafficking case against Epstein from 2002-2005 and outlines the tactical plan involving FBI and NYPD coordination.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the arrest and search warrant operation; accused of child sex trafficking from 2002-2005.

events.title: Epstein's Alleged Sex Trafficking
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein enticed and recruited dozens of minor girls, ages 14 to 17, in NY and FL to engage in sex acts with him, paying them in cash and encouraging them to recruit others.

events.title: Indictment of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Epstein was indicted for violations of 18 USC 1591 (sex trafficking) and 18 USC 371 (conspiracy). The indictment is sealed and an arrest warrant was issued out of SDNY.

events.title: Planned Arrest at Teterboro Airport
events.description: Epstein, scheduled to return to the US through Teterboro Airport at 5:20 PM, will be detained by CBP. FBI agents and NYPD detectives will coordinate with FBI Newark and CBP to effect the arrest.

events.title: Search Warrant Execution
events.description: Once Epstein is in custody, a search warrant for his premises at 9 East 71st Street, New York, NY will be sworn out and executed by agents and NYPD detectives.

events.title: Final Tactical Briefing
events.description: A final tactical briefing is scheduled at the C-20 squad area.

locations: 9 East 71st Street, New York, New York
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was indicted on July 2, 2019, for sex trafficking and conspiracy, with the indictment sealed.
The operational plan was to arrest Epstein on July 6, 2019, upon his return to the US via Teterboro Airport, with coordination between FBI, NYPD, FBI Newark, and CBP.
A search warrant for Epstein's New York residence at 9 East 71st Street was to be executed immediately following his arrest.
The case synopsis alleges Epstein recruited dozens of minor girls (ages 14-17) from 2002-2005 in NY and FL, paying them for sex acts and for recruiting other victims.
The document is an FBI operations order form, indicating a high level of planning and inter-agency coordination for the arrest.
